description: Variation of approved drawings (Condition 2) to allow changes to the finished floor levels of permission 00886/11/P18 dated 20/11/2012 allowed under APP/F5540/A/13/2197176 dated 26/09/2013 for demolition of and existing office building and underground parking and the erection of a new part three-storey and part four storey building for student accommodation.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall not begin later than three years from the date of the original decision.

Condition : 2 - Except as modified by Condition3 and 4 below, the development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance to the following approved plans: 498-01, 498-02, 498-03, 498-04, 498-05, 498-06, 498-07A, 498-08, 0855-JSA-XX-00A-DR-A-02001 rev. P10, 0855-JSA-XX-B1-DR-A-02001 Rev. P8, 0855-JSA-XX-00-DR-A-02001 Rev. P5, 0855-JSA-XX-02-DR-A-02001 Rev. P9, 0855-JSA-XX-01-DR-A-02001 Rev. P9, 0855-JSA-XX-XX-DR-A-03002 Rev. P5, 0855-JSA-XX-XX-DR-A-04002 Rev. P5, 498-109A, 498-110A, 498-111A, 498-112A, 498-113A, 498-118, Summary of proposed Section 73 changes to planning approval 00886/11/P18 prepared by Jefferson Sheard Architects and dated 24th Feb 2016. All plans and documents received on 18 March 2016.

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until details of the fenestration serving rooms FF-06 and SF-06 have been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Work shall be undertaken in accordance to the approved plans and retained thereafter.
Condition : 4 - Details of fenestration of the western elevation shall be implemented in line with approved plans under permission 00886/11/P18(3,4,7,9,12)
Condition : 5 - The building hereby approved shall be used as student accommodation containing no more than 77 units

Condition : 6 - No unit of accommodation shall be first occupied until a Student Accommodation Travel Plan, compliant with a) London-wide monitoring methodology (known as TRACE and TRAVL), and b)The Council?s 10 Point Guide to travel Plans has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Thereafter the content of the agreed plan shall be implemented in full unless varied by the prior written approval of the local planning authority
Condition : 7 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Demolition and Construction Management Plan approved under permission 00886/11/P18 (3,4,7,9,12)

Condition : 8 - No demolition or construction works shall take place on site except between 0800 and 1800 hours on Mondays to Fridays and 0900 and 1300 hours on Saturdays. No work shall take place on Sundays or Public Holidays without the prior written approval of the local planning authority
Condition : 9 - Materials to be used shall be implemented in line with approved permission 00886/11/P18 (3,4,7,9,12)

Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until full details of any hard and soft landscaping to be undertaken have been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Details shall include any means of enclosure, boundary treatment, the relationship of works to service infrastructure, planting plans and specifications, and implementation programme and details of arrangements for the replacement of any trees and shrubs which within five years of the completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased. Development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 11 - No fans, louvers, ducts or other external plant, other than as shown on the approved plans, shall be installed without the prior written approval of the local planning authority and any such work shall be undertaken in accordance to the approved details.

Condition : 12 - No development shall take place until an Energy Statement showing how the building can meet the requirements of London Plan policy 5.2 with a 25% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions on the 2010 Building Regulations, has been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall take place in accordance to the approved details prior to the first occupation of the building.

Condition : 13 - None of the student accommodation shall be first occupied until eight wheelchair accessible units have been provided and fitted out to meet the needs of wheelchair users. Such units shall be thereafter be permanently retained in this condition.

Condition : 14 - No development shall take place until details of a Sustainable Urban Drainage Scheme, to include the harvesting of rainwater, the minimisation of water run off from the site and the conservation and the re-use as appropriate of other water supplies in the building, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.Development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 15 - No development shall take place until a Contaminated Land Phase 1 desk study, and if as result of the findings, a Phase 2 study have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Such work shall be undertaken by a professional person competent to identify the nature and extent of any potential site contamination and should include a tiered risk assessment of any contamination based on the proposed end use of the site.
If, as a result of the above, a scheme for the decontamination of the site is necessary, this too shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and thereafter implemented as approved before any part of the development is first occupied.
If during development additional contamination is discovered, a competent person shall assess the contamination and submit appropriate amendments to the decontamination scheme to the local planning authority for its written approval before development work resumes. Any such additional measures shall be undertaken in accordance to the approved details.
